H0.text: Sediments cool to form sedimentary rock.

H1.text: Sediments melt is the process by which sedimentary rock forms.

H2.text: Sediments separate to form sedimentary rock.

H3.text: Sediments compress over time under pressure to form sedimentary rock.

A4.text: Sedimentary rocks are types of rock formed by the cementation of sediments—i.e. particles made of minerals (geological detritus) or organic matter (biological detritus)—that have been accumulated or deposited at Earth's surface.

A5.text: Lithification follows closely on compaction, as increased temperatures at depth hasten the precipitation of cement that binds the grains together.
